eligibilitiesChain.name: Hats Eligibilities Chain
eligibilitiesChain.details: Eligibility module that chains any amount of eligibility modules with 'and' & 'or' logical operations.

togglesChain.name: Hats Toggles Chain
togglesChain.details: Toggle module that chains any amount of toggle modules with 'and' & 'or' logical operations.

modules.name: Allowlist Eligibility
details: A Hats Protocol eligibility module that uses an allowlist to determine eligibility.

This module sets up a simple allowlist to determine eligibility for a hat. For a given account (i.e., potential hat wearer), the allowlist stores values for that account's eligibility and standing for the hat. The wearer(s) of the Owner Hat can add or remove accounts from the allowlist. The wearer(s) of the Arbitrator Hat can set the standing of accounts.

immutable.name: Owner Hat
immutable.description: The hat ID for the owner hat. The wearer(s) of this hat are authorized to add and remove accounts from the allowlist.

immutable.name: Arbitrator Hat
immutable.description: The hat ID for the arbitrator hat. The wearer(s) of this hat are authorized to set the standing for accounts.

writeFunctions.label: Add Account
writeFunctions.description: Add an account to the allow-list

args.name: Account
args.description: The account to add

writeFunctions.label: Add Accounts
writeFunctions.description: Add multiple accounts to the allow-list

args.name: Accounts
args.description: The accounts to add

writeFunctions.label: Remove Account
writeFunctions.description: Remove an account from the allow-list

args.name: Account
args.description: The account to remove

writeFunctions.label: Remove and Burn
writeFunctions.description: Remove an account from the allow-list and burn their hat

args.name: Account
args.description: The account to remove

writeFunctions.label: Remove Accounts
writeFunctions.description: Remove multiple accounts from the allow-list

args.name: Accounts
args.description: Accounts to remove

writeFunctions.label: Set Standing
writeFunctions.description: Set the standing for an account

args.name: Account
args.description: The account to set standing for

args.name: Standing
args.description: The standing to set

writeFunctions.label: Set Bad Standing and Burn Hat
writeFunctions.description: Puts an account in bad standing and burns their hat

args.name: Account
args.description: The account to set standing for

writeFunctions.label: Set Standings
writeFunctions.description: Set the standing for multiple accounts

args.name: Accounts
args.description: Accounts accounts to set standing for

args.name: Standings
args.description: The standings to set for each account, corresponding to the accounts order

modules.name: JokeRace Eligibility
details: By using this module, communities can elect the wearers of a hat through a JokeRace election. More specifically, the eligible wearers are creators of the top voted proposals in the election

The number of winners of an election, and thus the number of possible wearers made eligible through this integration, is configurable. Additionally, a term period can be set, after which the winners will no longer be eligible to wear the hat.
You must have already deployed a JokeRace contest before deploying this Eligibility Module.

immutable.name: Admin Hat
immutable.description: Optional admin hat, granted a permission to create a new term (reelection). If not provided (equals zero), then this permission is granted to the admins of the hat

mutable.name: JokeRace Contest
mutable.description: The JokeRace contest that facilitates the election

mutable.name: Term End
mutable.description: Timestamp of the term ending (in seconds)

mutable.name: Top K
mutable.description: First K winners of the election will be eligible

writeFunctions.label: Pull Election Results
writeFunctions.description: Pulls the election's final results

writeFunctions.label: New Term
writeFunctions.description: Setup a new term, once the current term has ended

args.name: Election
args.description: Address of the new JokeRace election

args.name: Term End
args.description: Timestamp of the new term ending

args.name: Top K
args.description: Amount of election winners

modules.name: ERC1155 Eligibility
details: A Hats Protocol eligibility module that checks if an address holds at least one minimum balance of a set of ERC1155 token Ids to determine eligibility

immutable.name: Number Of Tokens
immutable.description: Number of token IDs in the set of tokens that allow eligiblity

immutable.name: Token IDs
immutable.description: The token IDs within the ERC1155 contract that allow eligibilty

immutable.name: Minimum Balances
immutable.description: The minimum balances required (for token ID in the corresponding index) for eligibility

modules.name: ERC20 Eligibility
details: A Hats Protocol eligibility module that checks if an address owns a minimum balance of an ERC20 token to determine eligibility

immutable.name: Minimum Balance
immutable.description: Minimum amount of tokens in order to be eligible

modules.name: ERC721 Eligibility
details: A Hats Protocol eligibility module that checks if an address owns a minimum balance of an ERC721 token to determine eligibility

immutable.name: Minimum Balance
immutable.description: Minimum amount of tokens in order to be eligible

modules.name: Hat Wearing Eligibility
details: A Hats Protocol eligibility module that conditions eligibility for one hat based on wearing another hat.

One use of a hat is to serve as an encapsulation of a set of logic and conditions that serve as baseline eligibility criteria for other hats. This eligibility module builds on that idea by allowing a hat to be used as an eligibility criterion for another hat.

immutable.name: Criterion Hat
immutable.description: The ID of the hat which users will be required to wear in order to be eligible.

modules.name: Hats Election Eligibility
details: This module enables organizations to elect wearers of a given hat. More specifically, this modules makes certain accounts eligible to wear the given hat based on the submitted results of an election.
Election results are valid within a given term, after which the elected wearers become ineligible unless and until new election results are submitted.
This module works with any election mechanism that can output a list of winning addresses, such as onchain DAO proposals or an oSnap proposal.

immutable.name: Ballot Box Hat
immutable.description: This hat has the authority to submit election and recall results.

immutable.name: Admin Hat
immutable.description: Optional admin hat, granted authority to set up a new term. If not provided (equals zero), then this permission is granted to the admins of the hat.

mutable.name: Current Term End
mutable.description: Timestamp of the second following the end of the current term

writeFunctions.label: Start Next Term
writeFunctions.description: If the current term has passed and the next term's election is over, then start the next term

writeFunctions.label: Submit Election Results
writeFunctions.description: Submit the results of an election for a specified term

args.name: Election's Term End
args.description: Term end time of the election

args.name: Winners
args.description: The addresses of the winners of the election

writeFunctions.label: Submit Recall Election Results
writeFunctions.description: Submit the results of a recall election for a specified term

args.name: Election's Term End
args.description: Term end time of the election

args.name: Recallees
args.description: The addresses of the Recalled accounts

writeFunctions.label: set Next Term
writeFunctions.description: Set the next term. This will open the election for the next term. If the next term has already been set and is still open, this function can be used to change it.

args.name: New Term End
args.description: The end time of the term that will be opened

modules.name: JokeRace Eligibility
details: By using this module, communities can elect the wearers of a hat through a JokeRace election. More specifically, the eligible wearers are creators of the top voted proposals in the election

The number of winners of an election, and thus the number of possible wearers made eligible through this integration, is configurable. Additionally, a term period can be set, after which the winners will no longer be eligible to wear the hat.
You must have already deployed a JokeRace contest before deploying this Eligibility Module.
NOTE: proposals ranking is currently only supported in Jokerace contests with down-voting disabled, and so this module only works with down-voting disabled contests.

immutable.name: Admin Hat
immutable.description: Optional admin hat, granted a permission to create a new term (reelection). If not provided (equals zero), then this permission is granted to the admins of the hat

mutable.name: JokeRace Contest
mutable.description: The JokeRace contest that facilitates the election

mutable.name: Term End
mutable.description: Timestamp of the term ending (in seconds)

mutable.name: Top K
mutable.description: First K winners of the election will be eligible

writeFunctions.label: Pull Election Results
writeFunctions.description: Pulls the election's final results

writeFunctions.label: New Term
writeFunctions.description: Setup a new term, once the current term has ended

args.name: Election
args.description: Address of the new JokeRace election

args.name: Term End
args.description: Timestamp of the new term ending

args.name: Top K
args.description: Amount of election winners

modules.name: Multi Claims Hatter
details: A Hats Protocol hatter contract enabling explicitly eligible wearers to claim a hat.

mutable.name: Initial Claimable Hats
mutable.description: The ID of the hats to set claimability for

mutable.name: Initial Claimability Types
mutable.description: '1' to make a hat claimable by its wearers, '2' to make a hat also claimable on behalf of wearers

modules.name: Passthrough Eligibility and/or Toggle
details: A Hats Protocol module that enables an authorized hat to serve as the eligibility and/or toggle module for other hat(s).

Passthrough Module is a contract that can be set as the eligibility and/or toggle module for a target hat, and allows the wearer(s) of another hat to call the eligibility and/or toggle functions of the target hat. This allows hats themselves to be used as eligibility and toggle modules.

immutable.name: Criterion Token
immutable.description: The hat that will serve as an eligibility and/or toggle module

writeFunctions.label: Set Wearer's Status
writeFunctions.description: Set the eligibility and standing of a chosen hat wearer

args.name: Hat
args.description: ID of the hat to set the eligibility status for

args.name: Wearer
args.description: The address to set the eligibility status for

args.name: Eligibility
args.description: Is the wearer eligible for the hat

args.name: Standing
args.description: Is the wearer in good standing for the hat

writeFunctions.label: Set Hat's Status
writeFunctions.description: Set the status of a chosen hat

args.name: Hat
args.description: ID of the hat to set the status for

args.name: Status
args.description: Is the hat active

modules.name: Season Toggle
details: A Hats Protocol toggle module that allows an organization to configure certain hats to be automatically toggled off after a given interval, i.e. a 'season'.

In Hats Protocol, hats can be configured with Toggle modules that programmatically control whether and when the hat is active or inactive. Season Toggle adds an automatic expiry for a group of hats within a given branch of an organization's hat tree, unless an admin of that branch explicitly extends it to a new season.

mutable.name: Extension Delay
mutable.description: The proportion of the season that must elapse before the branch can be extended for another season, The value is treated as the numerator `x` in the expression `x / 10,000`

mutable.name: Season Duration
mutable.description: The length of the season, in seconds. Must be larger than 1 hour

writeFunctions.label: New Season
writeFunctions.description: Extend the branch for a new season, optionally with a new season duration

args.name: Duration
args.description: Optional new custom season duration, in seconds

args.name: Extension Delay
args.description: Optional new proportion of the season that must elapse before the branch can be extended for another season, The value is treated as the numerator `x` in the expression `x / 10,000`

modules.name: Staking Eligibility
details: A Hats Protocol eligibility module which requires wearers of a given hat to stake a minimum amount of a specified token in order to be eligible, and enables others in the Hat tree's organization to slash the stake of a wearer who is behaving badly.

immutable.name: Staking Token
immutable.description: ERC-20 Token which will be used for staking

mutable.name: Minimum Stake
mutable.description: The minimum stake required to be eligible for the hat

mutable.name: Judge Hat
mutable.description: The hat that can slash wearers

mutable.name: Recipient Hat
mutable.description: The hat that can withdraw slashed stakes

mutable.name: Cooldown Period
mutable.description: The number of seconds that must elapse between beginning an unstake and completing it. This should be set long enough to give a wearer of the judge hat enough time to slash a misbehaving staker before they can unstake

writeFunctions.label: Stake
writeFunctions.description: Stake tokens, whether for the first time or to increase an existing stake.

args.name: Amount
args.description: The amount of tokens to stake

writeFunctions.label: Begin Unstake
writeFunctions.description: Begin the process of unstaking an amount tokens by initiating a cooldown period, after which the tokens can be unstaked if the skater is not slashed in the meantime.

args.name: Amount
args.description: The amount of tokens to unstake

writeFunctions.label: Complete Unstake For Account
writeFunctions.description: Complete the process of unstaking for a staker after the cooldown period has elapsed.

args.name: Staker
args.description: The staker for which to complete unstaking

writeFunctions.label: Complete My Unstake
writeFunctions.description: Complete your unstaking process after the cooldown period has elapsed.

writeFunctions.label: Change Min Stake
writeFunctions.description: Change the minimum stake required to be eligible for the hat

args.name: Min Stake
args.description: The new minimum stake

writeFunctions.label: Change Judge Hat
writeFunctions.description: Change the hat that can slash wearers

args.name: Hat
args.description: The new judge hat

writeFunctions.label: Change Recipient Hat
writeFunctions.description: Change the hat whose wearer is the recipient of withdrawn slashed stakes

args.name: Hat
args.description: The new recipient hat

writeFunctions.label: Change Cooldown Hat
writeFunctions.description: Change the number of seconds that must elapse between beginning an unstake and completing it. This period should be long enough that a wearer of the Judge Hat has enough time to slash a misbehaving staker before they can unstake.

args.name: Cooldown Period
args.description: The new cooldown period

writeFunctions.label: Slash
writeFunctions.description: Slash a staker's full stake and set bad standing

args.name: Staker
args.description: The staker to slash

writeFunctions.label: Forgive
writeFunctions.description: Forgive a slashed address, placing them back in good standing and allowing them to stake again

args.name: Staker
args.description: The staker to forgive

writeFunctions.label: Withdraw
writeFunctions.description: Withdraw all slashed stakes to a wearer of the recipient hat

args.name: Recipient
args.description: The recipient of the withdrawn tokens, must wear the recipient hat
